projectPurpose: To provide a unified, high-performance, scalable, and cost-effective open-source platform for observability and monitoring, covering logs, metrics, traces, RUM, Error tracking, and Session replay, as an alternative to tools like Elasticsearch, Splunk, and Datadog.
mainFeatures: Unified logs, metrics, traces, RUM, Error tracking, Session replay

alternatives.name: Elasticsearch (part of Elastic Stack)
alternatives.license: Triple-licensed Elastic License, SSPL, and AGPL

alternatives.name: Prometheus + Grafana + Loki + Tempo
mainFeatures: Modular components for metrics (Prometheus), logs (Loki), traces (Tempo)

alternatives.name: New Relic
mainFeatures: Full-stack observability (APM, infra, logs, RUM, synthetics)

marketPositioning: OpenObserve is positioned as a disruptive open-source observability platform that directly challenges established proprietary solutions (Datadog, Splunk, New Relic) and complex open-source stacks (ELK, Grafana Ecosystem) by emphasizing significantly lower storage costs, high performance, scalability to petabytes, and ease of use. It aims to provide a unified, comprehensive observability experience (logs, metrics, traces, RUM, etc.) within a single, cost-efficient, and easier-to-manage open-source solution.
